analyzed: theḥ apadāna  padu mukkhi pa vagga
translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Padumuttara

analyzed: saraḥ āsi su nimmitaḥ  tattha aham rakkhasaḥ āsi
translated: there was a well-formed lake.🔽There I was a demon,
The compassionate, merciful🔽Vipassī, the Leader of the World,
the God of Gods, the Bull of Men,
came, I emerged from my lair

analyzed: ekanavutitaḥ kappe  yam vandim puris uttama
translated: For ninety-one eons🔽I bowed to the Supreme One.
I do not recall a bad destination,
this is the fruit of my bowing.

original: kataṁ buddhassa sāsanaṁ”.🔽Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā upāgatāsayo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: katam buddhassa sāsana  ittham sudam āyasmai upāgatāsayaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: I have done the Buddha’s bidding.”🔽Thus the elder Upāgatāsayan recited these verses.
The Elder Upāgatāsayan’s Birth Story is the ninth.
